name: NSScriptCommandDescription
desc: A script command that a macOS app supports.

items.name: init?(suiteName: String, commandName: String, dictionary: [AnyHashable : Any]?)
items.desc: Initializes and returns a newly allocated instance of NSScriptCommandDescription.

items.name: var appleEventClassCode: FourCharCode
items.desc: Returns the four-character code for the Apple event class of the receiver’s command.

items.name: var appleEventCode: FourCharCode
items.desc: Returns the four-character code for the Apple event ID of the receiver’s command.

items.name: var commandClassName: String
items.desc: Returns the name of the class that will be instantiated to handle the command.

items.name: var commandName: String
items.desc: Returns the name of the command.

items.name: var suiteName: String
items.desc: Returns the name of the suite that contains the command described by the receiver.

items.name: func appleEventCodeForArgument(withName: String) -> FourCharCode
items.desc: Returns the Apple event code for the specified command argument of the receiver.

items.name: var argumentNames: [String]
items.desc: Returns the names (or keys) for all arguments of the receiver’s command.

items.name: func isOptionalArgument(withName: String) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the command argument identified by the specified argument key is an optional argument.

items.name: func typeForArgument(withName: String) -> String?
items.desc: Returns the type of the command argument identified by the specified key.

items.name: var appleEventCodeForReturnType: FourCharCode
items.desc: Returns the Apple event code that identifies the command’s return type.

items.name: var returnType: String?
items.desc: Returns the return type of the command.

items.name: func createCommandInstance() -> NSScriptCommand
items.desc: Creates and returns an instance of the command object described by the receiver.

items.name: func createCommandInstance(with: NSZone?) -> NSScriptCommand
items.desc: Creates and returns an instance of the command object described by the receiver in the specified memory zone.
